steps.title: Cut a slit into the shirt on either side of the collar using some sharp fabric scissors.
steps.content: Cut a slit into the shirt on either side of the collar using some sharp fabric scissors. Cut the slit along the collar seam to serve as a visual guide for the rest of your cutting project. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Use fabric scissors to cut the collar off of the shirt.
steps.content: Use fabric scissors to cut the collar off of the shirt. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Grab the fabric at the shoulder seam and pull it.
steps.content: Grab the fabric at the shoulder seam and pull it. Doing this will make the neckline curl over.

steps.title: Wear the shirt over a tank top or a camisole.
steps.content: Wear the shirt over a tank top or a camisole.

steps.title: Get your shirt.
steps.content: Get your shirt.

steps.title: Put on the shirt that you want to cut.
steps.content: Put on the shirt that you want to cut.

steps.title: Measure the distance from the shoulder seam to just past your waistline using a vinyl tape measure.
steps.content: Measure the distance from the shoulder seam to just past your waistline using a vinyl tape measure. You want to leave just a little extra fabric so the shirt will roll up at your waistline and not high above it.

steps.title: Mark the measurement on your shirt using a fabric marker or a piece of chalk.
steps.content: Mark the measurement on your shirt using a fabric marker or a piece of chalk.

steps.title: Cut the shirt straight across using sharp fabric scissors.
steps.content: Cut the shirt straight across using sharp fabric scissors. It's easiest if you place the shirt on a flat surface.

steps.title: Pull the edges of the shirt so that the fabric will curl over.
steps.content: Pull the edges of the shirt so that the fabric will curl over.

steps.title: Finished!
steps.content: Finished! Wear and show off!

steps.title: Cut off the sleeves.
steps.content: Cut off the sleeves. Start about 1" (2.5 cm) below the armpit and cut all the way up to the neckline. Don't discard your scrap fabric.

steps.title: Trim off the neckline if you wish.
steps.content: Trim off the neckline if you wish. Cut at the seam so that you don't create a one-shoulder effect. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Pull the edges, so they curl over nicely.
steps.content: Pull the edges, so they curl over nicely. Optional: Lay the shirt face down on a flat surface. Pinch the fabric together at the base of the armpits. [5] X Research source Optional: Wrap your fabric scraps around the pinched area. Tie a knot to secure the fabric and tuck the knot underneath the wrap.

steps.title: Wear the shirt on its own.
steps.content: Wear the shirt on its own. If it reveals too much skin, then wear a bandeau or a tank underneath it.

steps.title: Choose a tight-fitting t-shirt for the best effect.
steps.content: Choose a tight-fitting t-shirt for the best effect.

steps.title: Select the area of your body that you want to expose.
steps.content: Select the area of your body that you want to expose. You can place razor slits across the back of your shirt, for instance.

steps.title: Lay your shirt on a flat surface.
steps.content: Lay your shirt on a flat surface. Place a cutting board between the front and back of your shirt so that you don't cut through both layers.

steps.title: Cut parallel horizontal lines in your shirt using a razor blade or a utility knife.
steps.content: Cut parallel horizontal lines in your shirt using a razor blade or a utility knife. You can cut lines of equal length, or you can cut a long line at the top and cut continuously shorter lines in sequence for a triangular effect.

steps.title: Finished!
steps.content: Finished! Optional: Wash the shirt. The sections that you cut will roll up at the edges to create a punk-ish effect.

steps.title: Cut the hem off of both your T-shirt sleeves using sharp fabric scissors.
steps.content: Cut the hem off of both your T-shirt sleeves using sharp fabric scissors.

steps.title: Use fabric scissors to cut a slit in the sleeves from the bottom to the shoulder seam.
steps.content: Use fabric scissors to cut a slit in the sleeves from the bottom to the shoulder seam.

steps.title: Pull the edges, so they curl over.
steps.content: Pull the edges, so they curl over. This will also give you more slack to for tying in the next step.

steps.title: Tie the loose edges of the fabric together at the base of the slit.
steps.content: Tie the loose edges of the fabric together at the base of the slit. This tie will create a cute peep-through effect.

steps.title: Done!
steps.content: Done! Wear your top with its cute new sleeves.
